text: Pneumonia is the leading cause of death in children < 5 years worldwide , which is responsible for one million deaths each year [ 1 ] . The burden is greatest in developing countries , at an estimated 0 . 22 episodes per child - year , but remains a major public health concern even among developed countries where there are an estimated 0 . 015 episodes per child - year [ 2 ] . In the USA , pneumonia is the second only to newborn infant births as the most common reason for hospital admissions ( 36 cases per 10 000 persons [ 3 ] ) and causes nearly 50 000 deaths each year [ 4 ] .
